description:
When an alien race known as the Oni invade Earth, the chronically unlucky and unapologetically lecherous Ataru Moroboshi is selected as humanity’s representative in a duel for the fate of the planet! His opponent is Lum, the Oni’s very pretty princess, and it’s only thanks to Ataru’s unscrupulous behavior that he’s able to scrape out a win in a treacherous game of tag against her. Ataru thinks he’s had his lucky break at last, but when Lum takes a shine to him off the battlefield, the conflict follows him home as Lum invades not only planet Earth, but also the womanizing Ataru’s love life!

(Source: HIDIVE)

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

tags.name: Tennis
tags.description: Centers around the sport of tennis.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/rumicworld1010)

Rumiko Takahashi is one of the wealthiest women in Japan. The manga she creates (and its anime adaptations) are very popular in the United States and Europe where they have been released as both manga and anime in English translation. Her works are relatively famous worldwide, and many of her series were some of the forerunners of early English language manga to be released in the nineties. Takahashi is also the best selling female comics artist in history; well over 100 million copies of her various works have been sold.

Though she was said to occasionally doodle in the margins of her papers while attending Niigata Chūō High School, Takahashi's interest in manga did not come until later. During her college years, she enrolled in Gekiga Sonjuku, a manga school founded by Kazuo Koike, mangaka of Crying Freeman and Lone Wolf and Cub. Under his guidance Rumiko Takahashi began to publish her first doujinshi creations in 1975, such as Bye-Bye Road and Star of Futile Dust. Kozue Koike often urged his students to create well-thought out, interesting characters, and this influence would greatly impact Rumiko Takahashi's works throughout her career.

Career and major works: Takahashi's professional career began in 1978. Her first published story was Those Selfish Aliens, a comedic science fiction story. During the same year, she published Time Warp Trouble, Shake Your Buddha, and the Golden Gods of Poverty in Shōnen Sunday, which would remain the home to most of her major works for the next twenty years. Later that year, Rumiko attempted her first full-length series, Urusei Yatsura. Though it had a rocky start due to publishing difficulties, Urusei Yatsura would become one of the most beloved anime and manga comedies in Japan. In 1980, Rumiko Takahashi found her niche and began to publish with regularity. At this time she started her second major series, Maison Ikkoku, in Big Comic Spirits. Written for an older audience, Maison Ikkoku is often considered to be one of the all-time best romance manga. Takahashi managed to work on Maison Ikkoku on and off simultaneously with Urusei Yatsura. She concluded both series in 1987, with Urusei Yatsura ending at 34 volumes, and Maison Ikkoku being 15.

During the 1980s, Takahashi became a prolific writer of short story manga, which is surprising considering the massive lengths of most of her works. Her stories The Laughing Target, Maris the Chojo, and Fire Tripper all were adapted into original video animations (OVAs). In 1984, after the end of Urusei Yatsura and Maison Ikkoku, Takahashi took a different approach to storytelling and began the dark, macabre Mermaid Saga. This series of short segments was published sporadically until 1994, with the final story being Mermaid's Mask. Many fans contend that this work remains unfinished by Takahashi, since the final story does not end on a conclusive note. Another short work left untouched is One-Pound Gospel, which, like Mermaid Saga, was published erratically. The last story to be drawn was published in 2001, however just recently she wrote one final chapter concluding the series.

Later in 1987, Takahashi began her third major series, Ranma ½. Following the late 80s and early 90s trend of shōnen martial arts manga, Ranma ½ features a gender-bending twist. The series continued for nearly a decade until 1996, when it ended at 38 volumes. Ranma ½ is one of Rumiko Takahashi's most popular series with the Western world. During the later half of the 1990s, Rumiko Takahashi continued with short stories and her installments of Mermaid Saga and One-Pound Gospel until beginning her fourth major work, InuYasha. While Ranma ½, Urusei Yatsura, and Maison Ikkoku all were heavily seated in the romantic comedy genre, InuYasha was more akin to her dark Mermaid Saga. The series became her most eclectic work, featuring action, romance, horror, fantasy, (folklore-based) historical fiction, and comedy.
Praised nationwide for his work as a character designer on [Osomatsu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/21261/).

[Official Website](https://hedzdayz.fullmecha.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/jnthed) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=4395) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hedz_fullmecha/)


Sometimes known as JNT.
He used to be a game designer and a graphic artist.

**Date of Birth:** ?? ??, 1977
**Residency:** Tokyo, Japan

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryohirata0110)** | **[Blog (JP)](http://hirataryo.cocolog-nifty.com/blog/)**

**Ryou Hirata** is a Japanese animator and designer, who does prop, character and art design.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.

__Graduated:__ Kunitachi College of Music (Department of Composition)

[Artist Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/masaruyokoyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaruyokoyama)

**Yokoyama Masaru** is a Japanese composer, arranger, keyboardist and programmer affiliated with Miracle Bus.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高村和宏)

A freelance animator formerly part of [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). Debuted on the 14th episode of [Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the other [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/223351/) with the exact same name._

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__[Profile (Kamitsubaki Studio)](http://kamitsubaki.jp/artist/kaf/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/virtual_kaf) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/virtual_kaf/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQ1U65-CQdIoZ2_NA4Z4F7A) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@virtual_kaf) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2c32JruIkUyfdycHmhIph4)__

__Kaf__ is a virtual Japanese singer affiliated and managed by Kamitsubaki Studio. She has been uploading original songs and covers to YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok since October 2018. All of her original songs were provided by [Iori Kanzaki](https://anilist.co/staff/180461/Iori-Kanzaki) until 2023, and her character designer is [PALOW](https://anilist.co/staff/306406/PALOW).

__Label:__ Warner Music Japan (since June 2020)
__Office:__ Victor Entertainment
__Genre:__ J-pop, Pop-Rock, Rock
__Instruments:__ Vocal, Guitar

[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2JzylaIF8qeowc7-5VwwmA) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/373STAFF/) | [Official Website](https://osakana373.therestaurant.jp/) | [Wikipedia (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minami_(singer)) | [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%BE%8E%E6%B3%A2_(%E3%82%B7%E3%83%B3%E3%82%AC%E3%83%BC%E3%82%BD%E3%83%B3%E3%82%B0%E3%83%A9%E3%82%A4%E3%82%BF%E3%83%BC))

In 2017, she released the first mini album "Emotional Water" and the first single "main actor". It was sold exclusively at Tower Records in Shibuya, Sapporo, Sendai, Nagoya, Osaka, Hiroshima and Fukuoka. In the same year, on August 24, she held her first live at the Shibuya Eggman, titled "Emotional Water ~ my teen finale ~," as she realized her dream of hosting a solo concert in her teens.

In January 2019, she officially debuted featuring her first single "Kawaki wo Ameku", which was used as the opening theme for winter anime "Domestic na Kanojo". Later that year, on spring, with the name "Kawakioameku", she toured for the first time since her debut.

edges.role: Theme Song Performance (OP1, OP2, ED1, ED2)

node.description:
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MAISONdes_6half) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/maisondes_6half/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgRgH7nHGEV7q0QrtIuWoUA) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@maisondes_6half) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/7LTiBdByoaUd329wCpmMcM)__

__MAISONdes__ is a Japanese music project. The project is about a fictitious apartment where each song assigned to a different room. Each room is 6 and a half tatami mat big and has a different story, singer and creator.

__[Website](https://skr-motimoti.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/skr_motimoti) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/skr_motimoti/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/SKRmotimoti)__

__SAKURAmoti__ is a Japanese Lyricist, Composer and VOCALOID producer.

__[Website](https://nmnlpop.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_23ki_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_23ki_/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpLKk1TqiGRqLWcR9_ZcNaA) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/7ctyyNnO9O2dDD8bHjkCAh)__

__Introduction:__
__Tsumiki__ is a Japanese VOCALOID producer and the composer of musical duo, NOMELON NOLEMON. 

__Biography:__
He debuted in 2017 with the VOCALOID song, "Tokyo Diver Fake Show" featuring [IA](https://anilist.co/staff/124349/) and quickly became popular on NicoNico debuting at number 19 on The Weekly VOCALOID Ranking the week of its release and going up to 3rd place the following week.

On his birthday August 11th 2021, __Tsumiki__ announced the formation of his musical group [NOMELON NOLEMON](https://anilist.co/staff/342602) with [Maria Miki](https://anilist.co/staff/199397/Maria-Miki).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yama_ic)

Yamashita is one of the key figures of the "Web Generation," being among the first to be recruited within the industry not after formal training but after demonstrating his talent by posting animated gifs online.

His first time standing out of the crowd was on [Birdy the Mighty Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/Birdy-the-Mighty-Decode/). His animation favors expression above all else, to the point characters often bend out of shape when exposed to extreme forces and speeds. 

Despite this he still has a keen eye for delicate and realistic character animation, inspired by the likes of [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/Norio-Matsumoto), as demonstrated on both EDs for Birdy the Mighty Decode and [Shinsekai yori](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/From-the-New-World/) where he handled all aspects of the animation production. 

He is also adept in post production work, often handling the photography, coloring and even CG in his own works.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iii0303_8) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHGKS3VDKxu3N1u9naM0XYA) Surii is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger and music producer. Best known for his various original vocaloid songs featuring [Len Kagamine](https://anilist.co/staff/154290/Len-Kagamine).
